title: Re: Pedo...
content:
LL: "Nature never discriminates on age, there are many interesting cases of paedeophilia in animals."

Actually it does - you'll notice that adult animals (say birds for instance) are very brightly coloured, to attract attention from the opposite sex. Young animals however don't develop these bright colours until quite a while after they're born (depending on their lifespan.) This is so that they don't attract attention from potential mates until they're fully matured (as evolutionarily speaking, it would be a waste of energy if there was no chance of getting pregnant. Much better to focus on a mature mate with a very high chance of pregnancy, thus resulting in the furthering of the species.)

It is interesting to note though, that for these animals paedeophilia doesn't seem to be taboo - it's only humans that have developed this idea.

I guess it's just easier to traumatise young humans this way compared to other animals.
